content:
Yes, many recent breakthroughs have won scientific prizes. Here are a few examples:

1. Nobel Prize in Chemistry 2020: Emmanuelle Charpentier and Jennifer Doudna were awarded the prize for the development of a method for genome editing known as CRISPR/Cas9.

2. Breakthrough Prize in Life Sciences 2021: David Baker was awarded the prize for his work on developing new computational methods for designing proteins.

3. Fields Medal 2018: Caucher Birkar was awarded the Fields Medal for his contributions to algebraic geometry.

4. Lasker-DeBakey Clinical Medical Research Award 2019: Gladstone Institutes scientists and their collaborators were awarded for the development of CAR T-cell therapy for cancer treatment.

5. Turing Award 2020: Alfred Aho and Jeffrey Ullman were awarded the Turing Award for their work on compiler theory and its impact on computer science.

These are just a few examples of the many recent scientific breakthroughs that have been recognized with prestigious prizes.
